library_of_life.vocabulary.concepts module

class library_of_life.vocabulary.concepts.Concepts(use_caching=False, cache_name='concepts_cache', backend='sqlite', expire_after=3600, auth_type='basic', client_id=None, client_secret=None, token_url=None)[source]

Bases: object

A class for interacting with the concepts section of the Vocabulary API.

endpoint

endpoint for this section of the API.

add_alternative_label_to_concept(vocabulary_name, name, username, password, payload)[source]

Creates an alternative label and adds it to an existing concept.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The user’s password.

  • payload (dict) – The json response body containing new label. See this endpoint’s docs for schema.

Returns:

Dictionary or string containing an error message or returned alternative label if successful.

Return type:

dict, str

create_new_concept(vocabulary_name, username, password, payload)[source]

Creates a new concept. Note definitions, labels, alternative labels, hidden labels and tags must be added in subsequent requests.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The user’s password.

  • payload (dict) – The request body JSON object.

Returns:

Dictionary or string containing an error message or returned concept if successful.

Return type:

dict, str

  • key (int) – The key of the label.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

Returns:

A message of success or failure of delete.

deprecate_existing_concept(vocabulary_name, name, username, password, payload=None)[source]

Deprecates the existing concept. Optionally, a replacement concept can be specified and the replacement must belong to the same vocabulary. Note that if the concept has children they have to be either deprecated or reassigned to the replacement if it’s specified. If they should be deprecated it has to be specified explicitly in the parameters.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

  • payload (dict) – The json object response body.

Returns:

A message of success or failure of update.

Return type:

string, dict

Gets the definition of the concept.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • key (int) – The key of the definition.

Returns:

A dictionary containing concept definition.

Return type:

dict

list_all_alternative_concept_labels(vocabulary_name, name, language)[source]

Lists all alternative labels of the concept.

Arg:

vocabulary_name (str): The name of the vocabulary. name (str): The name of the concept. language (str): Languages to filter by.

Returns:

Return type:

list

list_all_alternative_labels_of_concept_from_latest_release_of_vocabulary(vocabulary_name, name, language, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Lists all alternative labels of the concept from the latest release of the vocabulary.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • language (str) – Languages to filter by. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the alternative labels.

Return type:

dict

restore_deprecated_concept(vocabulary_name, name, username, password, restore_deprecated_children: bool | None = None)[source]

Restores the deprecated concept. Its vocabulary cannot be deprecated. If the concept used to have a parent and now it’s deprecated it will be replaced with its replacement if exists. Optionally, it can also be specified to restore all the deprecated children of the concept.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

  • restore_deprecated_children (bool) – Set to true to restore deprecated concepts.

Returns:

A message of success or failure of update.

Return type:

string, dict

suggest_concepts(vocabulary_name, locale, query: str | None = None)[source]

Search that returns up to 20 matching concepts. Results are ordered by relevance. The response is smaller than a concept search.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • locale (str) – Required. Locale to filter by. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the concept suggestions.

Return type:

dict

suggest_concepts_from_latest_vocabulary_release(vocabulary_name, locale, query: str | None = None)[source]

Search that returns up to 20 matching concepts from the latest release of the vocabulary. Results are ordered by relevance. The response is smaller than a concept search.

Parameters:

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • locale (str) – The locale. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported

Returns:

A dictionary containing suggestions.

Return type:

dict

  • username (str) – The username.

update_existing_concept(vocabulary_name, name, username, password, payload)[source]

Updates the existing concept. Note definitions, labels, alternative labels, hidden labels and tags are not changed with this method.

  • vocabulary_name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • name (str) – The name of the concept.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

  • version (str) – The version to filter by. To get the latest one you can specify ‘latest’.

list_all_vocabularies(name: str | None = None, namespace: str | None = None, deprecated: bool | None = None, vocab_key: int | None = None, has_unreleased_changes: bool | None = None, query: str | None = None, limit: int | None = None, offset: int | None = None)[source]

Lists all current vocabularies.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Optional. The name of the vocabulary.

  • namespace (str) – Optional. The namespace of the vocabulary.

  • deprecated (bool) – Optional. Is the vocabulary deprecated?

  • vocab_key (int) – Optional. The key of the vocabulary.

  • has_unreleased_changes (bool) – Optional. Has the vocabulary changes that haven’t been released yet?

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the vocabulary search results.

Return type:

dict

list_all_vocabulary_labels(name, language)[source]

Lists all labels of the vocabulary.

Arg:

name (str): The name of the vocabulary. language (str): Languages to filter by.

Returns:

A list containing the vocabulary labels.

Return type:

list

Arg:

name (str): The name of the vocabulary. language (str): Languages to filter by.

Returns:

A list containing the vocabulary definitions.

Return type:

list

list_vocabulary_releases(name, version: str | None = None, limit: str | None = None, offset: str | None = None)[source]

Search that returns up to 20 matching vocabularies. Results are ordered by relevance. The response is smaller than a vocabulary search.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • version (str) – Optional. The version to filter by. To get the latest one you can specify ‘latest’.

  • limit (int) – Optional. Controls the number of results in the page. Using too high a value will be overwritten with the default maximum threshold, depending on the service. Sensible defaults are used so this may be omitted.

  • offset (int) – Optional. Determines the offset for the search results. A limit of 20 and offset of 40 will get the third page of 20 results. Some services have a maximum offset.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the vocabulary release information.

Return type:

dict

restore_deprecated_vocabulary(name, username, password, restore_deprecated_concepts: bool | None = None)[source]

Restores the deprecated vocabulary. Optionally, its deprecated concepts can be restored too if it is specified in the parameters.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

  • restore_deprecated_concepts (bool) – Set to true to restore deprecated concepts.

Returns:

A message of success or failure of update.

Return type:

string, dict

Search that returns up to 20 matching vocabularies. Results are ordered by relevance. The response is smaller than a vocabulary search.

Parameters:

  • locale (str) – Required. Locale to filter by. See this endpoint’s docs for available values.

  • query (str) – Optional. Simple full text search parameter. The value for this parameter can be a simple word or a phrase. Wildcards are not supported.

Returns:

A dictionary containing the vocabulary suggestions.

Return type:

dict

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

Return type:

string, dict

update_vocabulary_definition(name, key, username, password, payload)[source]

Updates a definition that belongs to an existing vocabulary.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the vocabulary.

  • key (int) – The key of the definition.

  • username (str) – The username.

  • password (str) – The password.

  • payload (dict) – The json object response body.

Returns:

A message of success or failure of update.

Return type:

string, dict
